As Danny sat to sort out his situation, he heard the hospital room door open. Glancing up, Danny saw another familiar face, his father. Well, “familiar” might not be the exact word here, because Danny rarely saw his father back home. His father tended to work extended hours as the CEO of a defense contracting business. Danny briefly remembered the fun times he has spent with his dad back when he was in elementary school, before his dad started the business corporation. He would always pick Danny up after school to play ball in a neighborhood park. On weekends, his dad would take him biking on various biking trails around town. Sure, his mom was the first to teach him how to ride, but his dad had spent the most time biking with him. Danny eventually grew fond of biking from these trips and has continued riding on biking trails through high school.

However, these moments of his childhood did not last, as his dad was forced to find a new job due to the economic recession 8 years ago. Luckily, this new job was prosperous, and Danny’s family was spared from economic risk. In fact, his dad’s job as the CEO earned more salary than his previous job, making him wealthy. Of course, the drawback is the dwindling time spent at home. As the corporation received more and more contracts, mainly from the government military, Danny’s father spent less and less time with his family. Before Danny knew it, the previous ritual of spending time with his dad had become a rare occasion. He would still show up to major events such as birthdays and school honor ceremonies, but those would become the remaining moments Danny would truly see his father. Danny never resented his father for what he did, as it can’t be helped. But he would occasionally feel nostalgic about the times back in elementary school…

“Lisa, are you alright?” Danny’s dad waved in front of his face, snapping Danny from his thoughts.

“Oh, hi da-, I mean, honey. Sorry, I was just lost in thought. Today has just been one jumbled mess,” Danny replied.

His dad gave a somber yet reassuring look. “I’m sure things will work out in the end. We just have to believe in Danny.”

Danny looked into his father’s eyes for comfort.

“It pains me so much to see Danny like this. Even though I’m rarely home, I still miss the fun times with Danny before I started my business. When I heard that Danny was in an accident and in critical condition, I told Angela to quickly cancel my appointments for the day and rushed here to the hospital,” Danny’s dad gave a nod toward the dark honey blonde woman standing the door. The woman was Angela Mulbury, his dad’s current personal assistant. Danny met her once or twice, usually tailing his father when he attended some of Danny’s parties or ceremonies. It gives him a subtle reminder that his dad would have to return to work. Danny would almost consistently see her on her phone, managing his dad’s tight work schedule. Danny could only fathom that Angela is on her phone now to cancel all those plans for today.

A moment later, Mindy returned with a cup of water. After handing the cup to Danny, she looked toward his dad. “You must be Mr. Wilkins. I’m sorry for what has happened to your son.”

“Thanks for your concern. So what is Danny’s current condition?”

“Danny is still in a comatose state. His vital signs look fine, but he seems to have suffered decent head trauma. We have sedated him to keep him from feeling any pain. I’m currently responsible for monitoring him, and there will always be a nurse to watch over him. I can’t give you a prognosis right now; that will have to wait until doctors come to examine him in an hour or so. But we will do our very best to help him recover as quickly as possible,” Mindy replied in a solemn tone.

“Thank you so much, nurse. I hope to hear good news from the doctors as soon as possible.”

While Mindy was speaking with his dad, Danny was sitting behind, listening in while drinking the water given by Mindy. Despite Mindy’s best efforts to ease concerns, Danny was still worried about his condition. “Her response was pretty much the same as before. I hope they are not hiding something more serious. Where are the doctors anyway? Is the response this slow for a patient in critical condition? Or actually, do they even know how to treat a patient whose spirit is outside of their body?” Danny thought.

Danny’s father must have noticed Danny’s worried expression hanging on his mother’s face. He approached Danny and was about to pat on his shoulder.

While Danny still didn’t know the intricacies, he knew that he first switched into Mindy’s body through a pat on the shoulder. Instinctively, Danny waved his dad away, “Don’t touch me!” Almost instantaneously, Danny regret those words, as he saw his dad with a shocked and worried expression.
